content: Lifestyle General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Jun 2019Any tips on recycling e-waste such as my old mobile phones? Have so many phones lying around, would be a waste if I cannot recycle them.3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 12 Jun 2019Again, going to the latest resources by NEA:StarHub's RENEW (REcycling Nation's Electronic Waste) Programme you can definitely recycle your mobile phone, amongst other things like laptops, cables and plugs etcBest Denki, Courts, Gain City and Harvey Norman have joined the RENEW programme - so you can check them out for the RENEW bins!See the full list of RENEW bins here:  https://www.starhub.com/about-us/corporate-sustainability/recycling-nations-electronic-waste.html Singtel x SingPost E-Waste Recycling Programmewith this programme, you can definitely recycle your mobile phone, amongst other things like laptops, cables and plugs etc AS LONG AS it fits into the deposit slotfull list of their recycling bins here:  http://recycle.sg/ There are many more options as well: https://www.nea.gov.sg/our-services/waste-management/3r-programmes-and-resources/e-waste-management/where-to-recycle-e-waste0 comments3

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 12 Jun 2019In some HDB Estates, they have recycling Bins for electronics.You may want to check with your CC, if there are any near to you or the nearest one from you0 comments1
Vivien Lee FengLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 18 Jun 2019There are e-bins under some hdb blocks nowadays! Good initiative0 comments0
